Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Laura A
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked into Hotel Navona, which is owned by the same family. However, on check-in, the owner informed us that some building work was taking place and offered us to move to Residenza Zanardelli. He also offered complimentary breakfast for myself and my partner, which we had added to our booking at Hotel Navona at an additional charge. The owner drove us to the Zanardelli. The hotel is charming - we could not fault it at all. The location is absolutely perfect and the hotel is spotlessly clean and offers the 'boutique' charm you would expect. Breakfast was simple yet fine and the young girl who was on reception was very helpful and sweet. We managed to pick up a map at the Hotel Navona, which was free to take away (and we couldn't have been without it). Everything was within walking distance. The only public transport we took was to airport and back. We opted for taxis - these work out at about 40 euros. If you are staying at the Zanardelli and are a light sleeper, I would recommend taking ear-plugs. The room we were in overlooks a narrow side street which is used as a route for a lot of walking tours - and there is quite a lot of noise created by this early morning/late evening. However, we found that keeping the windows closed sorted it. I can't comment on the aircon as we had no need for it - we opted for the windows to be open. Also, our TV didn't work. We probably could have asked and they would have sorted it but we were not bothered. The bathrooms are very modern and clean - they look like they have recently been refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable firm bed. Well-situated but loud location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustMBA
Reviews.Content: The linens were clean. The mattress was firm. The bathroom was clean. The shelves in the closet were dusty. The staff are cross-trained for cleaning staff and front-desk staff- very different skill sets are needed. The room keys hang on a board for anyone to take when front-desk isn't staff or being watched- strange.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delighted!”
Reviews.Author: tvaiotu64
Reviews.Content: This place helped make our stay in Roma such a joy. Staff were wonderful, location was great, breakfasts were excellent. Would definitely go there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and a perfect location for central Rome”
Reviews.Author: mike_garley
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the same owner's Hotel Navona but when I arrived I was told that they had moved me to this accommodation near the other end of the Piazza Navona (Hotel Navona seemed to be occupied by a large group of late teenage girls and I think they basically took pity on me). The Residenza is very small (only 7 rooms) and on the first floor of an 18th (I think) century building. Although it is supposed to be staffed there is frequently no-one around - although they do give you keys to the outside door to the street and the inner door to the Residenza area so this was not an issue. Rooms and bathroom good sized and very clean although little clothes hanging/storage space if you are there for more than a few days. One large table in the breakfast room and a fairly standard buffet breakfast for this type of hotel in Italy (although I was told on the booking form that breakfast was not included, it was). Internally very quiet (rarely saw or heard any of my fellow guests although I think there were some). Earplugs possibly advisable if you have a room that looks onto the narrow side road - sound does echo round here at night when anyone uses the road. Beautifully situated for the main sites of the Centro Storico and the Vatican. Many restaurants within easy walk in the evening away from the tourist trap of the Piazza Navona. I was not overly impressed with the knowledge of the young man who ususlly seemed to be on duty when you could find him, but this mattered little to me. Staff at Hotel Navona helpful when it came to advising staff at the return shuttle I had booked to Fiumicino of my change of address

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SusanParys
Reviews.Content: Not only was the hotel rooms in a 5 star condition, but the hotel is also located close to most attractions. Will defenetly recommend to everyone visiting Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Beth1981
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, safe and quiet but within easy walking distance to all the sights (Pantheon only 5 minutes walk away at the most). Exceptionally clean establishment. Bathroom small but perfectly adequate and again very clean. Air conditioning worked well and very useful in August! Rooms looked recently decorated, bed comfortable. Mini bar/fridge very useful and reasonable charged. Did not have breakfast so can't comment on that. Hotel photos are accurate though. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RICKOklahoma-usa
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome several times, this was by far the best hotel and the best location for everything. Rick/Oklahoma

Reviews.Title: “Good location but don't expect the staff to be interested in you or your enjoyment of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn_L81
Reviews.Content: Good location but extremely difficult to find. Staff are unwelcoming and unhelpful ie can't even recommend somewhere to eat!!. Breakfast is poor, rooms are ok in size and are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just a well located B&B, nothing more...”
Reviews.Author: Quinzico
Reviews.Content: Hi, It's just an old apartment transformed in a guest house! It does not have any other services other then the room and breakfast. The rooms are old, but OK (just OK). It is very well located (in the heart of rome), about 10-15 min walk to the Vatican city, Forum and other major attractions. The breakfast is very poor and I needed to ask several times for bread, so that the staff (2 people at the most) could put it on the table. Overall, it is quite expensive for what you get and the major plus is the location. I definitely won't go back to this BED and BREAKFAST.

Reviews.Title: “very old”
Reviews.Author: linda01609
Reviews.Content: The house staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very small and need MAJOR cleaning and updating. The linens were very clean and fresh. The location is great. I would not recommend it unless you really don't care about your room. It is old hotel style and smell for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan2264_34373
Reviews.Content: We loved staying in this hotel. Perfect location, extremely clean, great staff, and close to everything. It was enjoyable in every way. We took a group of 20 students and adults on a study abroad trip, and had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Xavier74
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size, the beds comfortable and it was very quiet. Everywhere was very clean. The staff were very friendly but had a limited knowledge of the city so weren't always able to answer questions or make recommendations. Breakfast is a pretty desolate affair with a everyone seated round a small table in a room with no windows. In addition there is a little notice informing you that you are allowed only one cup of coffee with your breakfast and any subsequent cups will be charged at 1 euro extra. However, for location and comfort I do think it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Your home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Susannietta
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant! And - eventhough we spent only very little time in our hotelroom in Residenza Zanardelli - I immediately felt at home. I also liked the idea of eating breakfast around one big table. A nice place!

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: cherieparis_Europe
Reviews.Content: First time that ive been to rome and i have to say ive been really lucky having read about residenza zanardelli as its the perfect spot in central rome. Its not a hotel where you have luxuries, pool, or a huge buffe breakfast... but i dont think that whoever goes to rome wants to stay in the room as there s soo many sites to visit. The breakfast consists of fresh crossants and danishes, bread, nutella, fruit jams, fruit, coffee, tea or juice, which did just fine for us, the room is always clean and heated with an lcd tv and shower, a bus stop is right outside the residence and piazza navona one minute away by walk. The only downside is as soon as we arived by a transfer we booked through residenza zanardelli he couldnt find it as there s no signs on the outside... so it definetly needs a sign.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly,grat location and value”
Reviews.Author: jjmurph
Reviews.Content: We had fabulous six days in Rome thanks to the Residenza Zanardelly comfortable accomodations, very friendly and helful staff. The small, imaculately clean hotel is a hidden jem in the best part of Rome and a walking distance from everything you would like to see. It has an artistic atmosphere, a smiling one person staff at all times and a huge bouquet of fresh flowers to greet you first. For people with soul it's a great place to stay. Thank you Residenza Zanardelli, we would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DRinlondon
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Zanardelli is a 7-room residence on the second floor of a building on Via Zanardelli. It was initially a little hard to find but only because the sign on the front was covered by some scaffolding. We took the bus here from Roma Termini station and the building is next door to a Persian rug store (on the opposite side of the road from the Hotel Genio). The place isn't very large - all the rooms lead off the reception/lobby area. Our room was extremely comfortable - nice bed, lovely furnishings, flat screen TV and very well heated even though we didn't require it as the weather was pleasant. The shower didn't work very well but was adequate and I'm not sure if this was due to low water pressure. The room had large windows which opened out onto an alley below and wooden shutters which shut out the street noise. As this hotel is in a very central location and only two doors down from a cocktail bar, it is inevitable that there'll be the usual sounds of the city - but after long days of sightseeing, sleeping soundly shouldn't be a problem! Noise from within the hotel was something else though - you can hear other guests talking if they're in the lobby and the reception phone ringing. This problem could be solved by perhaps shutting the connecting door between lobby and reception and if a polite notice was put up for other guests to keep their voices down. Breakfast was served in a communal dining room and consisted of continental staples - coffee, milk, juice, cereal, croissants, cheese and ham. The sweet croissants were delicious but considering it's Italy, the cheese and cold meat could be much better if they were bought from a market or deli as they seemed to be processed. You can also request for a cappuccino or latte which will be made for you. The Residenza Zanardelli is in an absolutely ideal location to explore most of Rome's tourist attractions. It's less than a 5-minute walk to Piazza Navona, 10 minutes to the Pantheon and about 15-20 minutes walk to the Vatican. Other sights such as the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Venezia and Colosseum are easily reachable by foot. There are some great restaurants and bars down the little streets leading off Piazza Navona - do not fall for the tourist trap cafes dotted around the Piazza as they are very expensive. For a true local experience, the Pizzeria Montecarlo and Pizzeria Baffetto are highly recommended. Rome is a wonderful city to explore and the Residenza Zanardelli provided us with a very comfortable stay. The little drawbacks mentioned before can be easily remedied and did not spoil our stay in any way. The staff were also very friendly and helpful and we'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: jodm
Reviews.Content: This is a tiny hotel/bed and breakfast but it does not claim to be anything other than that. The location was fabulous; I was travelling with my 5 year-old and the proximity of the Piazza Navona and the fabulous gelateria/pizzaria on its corner was a blessing for quick meals. The breakfast was sufficient and at a communal table which allowed us to meet some other travellers. My only real negative observation was the lack of sound-proofing, both internal and external; noise from other residents and outside revellers kept me awake for the first few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rude owner”
Reviews.Author: majory
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" is not a hotel, the name says it, "Residenza". It is part (7 rooms )of the second floor of a building in a good location of Rome (P. Navona). As far as I can tell it's as close to a bed and breakfast as you'll ever find, just don't tell the owner. He very rudely explained that we were lucky to even BE there, that it's very exclusive and he doesn't rent to just anybody (what does he do, a background check?) MY opinion- it's a bed and breakfast - it's adequate and has a good location - THAT'S IT, end of story, it's not fancy, it has no amenities, (you lug your suitcases unto the elevator and lug them off yourself, no room service, no laundry service, etc.) the breakfast is adequate and so was the price (sort of, 165 Euro a night).

Reviews.Title: “immaculate, central & yes, noisy”
Reviews.Author: norah50
Reviews.Content: 2006 Nov. Be honest with your expectations. This is a basic, centrally located hotel on a main road in front of a very busy bus stop - the area is quite noisy. Slept with the windows closed. After the first night, fatigue solved the noise problem. We found the 50F ambient temp warm, thus the room felt "hot". Meanwhile the Romans were in heavy coats. There is no "lobby", one is renting a typical European room. Immaculate. Small shower with ample hot water. Roll, juice & coffee for breakfast at a small common table. A sincere staff maintains distance unless some assistance is requested - it felt very private. The area is safe, one minor, if obvious, pick-pocket approach over a four day stay. ("Is this your ring? I found it....") The Campo di Fiori market is five minutes away and a daily stop for fruit & bread. There is a small grocery by the Pantheon. Navona or Pantheon for the late evening sit. Zio Ciro Mangianapoli (yellow & orange) just north of the Pantheon for a cordial, affordable & tasty sit-down meal. We walked everywhere, & constantly, but could have bused. I hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fortuitous!”
Reviews.Author: Smeagol
Reviews.Content: we checked out of a 5 star indisgust - the Zanardelli were our rescue - great location, courteous (if not chatty) staff, very clean, nicely appointed rooms. Everything it says on the tin! The location if just perfect - just off Piazza Navona - air con, large room, shower-room (no bath), reasonable breakfast - would stay again - no question, and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Rude”
Reviews.Author: GiGiII
Reviews.Content: The manager of the hotel was so incredibly rude to my husband and me that we left after the first night. We planned on staying 4. I have never left a hotel where we had reservations. The majority of my travel experiences in Italy have been wonderful, so I was shocked by how poorly we were treated. It seemed as though the hotel was so popular that they were not worried in the slightest about how they treated people.

Reviews.Title: “Pensione of character.”
Reviews.Author: Deanfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my 2 teenage children. We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay, found the staff friendly and helpful, and the room good. After all, in Rome you're not going to spend time in the room, except to sleep and change your shoes! We walked everywhere (St Peter's, colosseum, Villa Borghese, Trevi fountain etc. etc.) from here, easy walking and very safe.The detailed map was useful, the dining room cosy, and friendly to share with other guests. Easy to exchange tips and ideas for visits over the bread rolls! The paper cups for the orange juice were not a worry. Don't stay here, however, if you are a light sleeper. It is in the very centre of Rome's Centro storico, and is an old buidling, so no modern double glazing to keep out the sounds of Roman life. If you keep walking, you'll be too tired to notice!

Reviews.Title: “A deceptive hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to land in Rome and were looking forward to our stay at the 'Residenza Zanardelli'.I had planned the trip as a surprise gift for my wife. But on arrival we were disappointed. The 'welcome' desk gave new meaning to the term 'indifferent', and the room we were offered was cramped and noisy. I don't often complain about accommodation, but the poor service and the general shabbiness of the rooms at Zanardelli made me so annoyed that I think others should be warned. The hotel is owned by the same people that run the 'Hotel Navona' - which the 'Rough Guide' lists as being run by a friendly Italian/Australian couple. We certainly did not find any friendship or co-operation. Both establishments, in our opinion, are a total disgrace. Please don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!!”
Reviews.Author: UptownCat
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was really well located (we could walk to everywhere from here) and so close to our two favorite areas at night - Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. Immediately upon arrival, they gave us a detailed map and let us know the walking distance to the major areas and where many restaurants were. Yes, rooms and bathrooms were rather small, but it was Italy after all - all our hotels were like this. Only drawback - no blowdryer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Zanardelli has 7 rooms located on the first floorWhen you walk into reception it is cool and smells fresh. The rooms are clean and well decorated and have proper air-con units.. Staff are very pleasant and helpful and the hotel is perfectly located 2 minutes from the Piazza Navona. It suits as a basic city hotel as we were so busy sight seeing all day. All the residents had breakfast together and it was nice to chat. We would definately stay again and it was our first visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My classmates and I spent 3 weeks in Residenza Zanardelli and i believe the majority of us loved it there, i know i did. It was nice because it did'nt scream Hotel, i felt less like a tourist there, and more like i belonged. It's in a perfect area, you're a hop, skip, and a jump away from anything you want to see or anywhere you want to go, and if need be you're right next to the bus stop. The staff is quite friendly, the the place is kept extremely neat. The room size is kind of small, but it grows on you; we managed to fit 3 comfortably. Overall i had a great experience there, and would recommend it to most.

Reviews.Title: “lucky escape”
Reviews.Author: tarrantini
Reviews.Content: As expected, we were asked to pay in cash on arrival. Before we paid, they reluctantly agreed to show us the room. We had requested (months in advance) a quiet room with a double bed. We were given a very small room on the main road with twin beds pushed together. I showed the staff the exchange of e-mails but they couldn?t understand the problem. They informed us that all double beds in Rome (and Paris, incidentally) are twins joined together. The fact that we had to raise our their voices each time a truck passed by seemed irrelevant. The room had double-glazing and therefore, it had to be a quiet room. We walked out and trusted our guide book to find alternative accommodation. The Hotel Raphael is in, what must be the perfect location, just behind the Piazza Navonna. We were offered the last suite at the rate of a double room. The stay at this hotel are both charming and helpful. Despite the Residenza Zanardelli informing us that booking a table for Valentine?s night would not be a problem , it was. In hindsight, we were foolish to think otherwise. After much pleading, the owner of Terra di Sienna agreed to accept us as her final booking. At dinner, she translated the menu for us with good humour and unending patience. We were treated to superb food in a wonderfully relaxed and friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better! Within walking distance of "all" the major sights. Our two double occupancy rooms were tastefully and newly decorated in an "old world" flair. Spaceous as well, bathroom could have used another couple of centimeters but the eclectic fittings and style of the entire room made up for it. Breakfast is sufficient, but not luxurious (your basic continental breakfast). The staff were helpful, but not overly cheerful. But overall, we couldn't have been more pleasantly satiesfied.

Reviews.Title: “Bruised Knees But Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Residenza was TINY. My knees were bruised after our stay there due to awkwardly trying to manuever aroun the double bed which was nearly as long as the room itself. The bathroom, while quite modern, was an equally tiny space. The hotel, while not charming, which clean and seemed to be well run. The breakfast was extremely basic. However, the staff was quite friendly, and you simply could not beat the location, which is steps from Piazza Navona and the river.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...but tell the Taxi Driver”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even though Zanardelli is a major street only a block from the Narvona Piazza, our Taxi driver couldn't find it. Get better directions from the hotel than the ones they give which is "for every convenience, take a taxi and ring the bell at number 7." The number 7 is not easy to see and there is no outside signage except on the doorbell. The Residenza is on the first floor (in the States, that's the second floor). however, there is a charming ironwork lift. There are only 6 rooms and they are spacious with nice bathrooms and comfortable beds. We were on the back (# 5) and our room was very quiet. The desk has a stack of guidebooks to Rome which are available for you to borrow. The location is great, within walking distance of St. Peters, the Forum, Spanish Steps, etc. The streets running off of the Navarona Piazza have wonderful little restaurants. The traffic is as bad as you have been told, but if you cross at a crosswalk, hold your hand out....they will stop. There is a free tour of the Forum at 4 pm (starts at the Arch) as well as at St. Peters at 10 am. Don't be afraid to join them. You will see the young guides and they will ask you if you would like to join a free tour in English. It is not a scam. These are given by English speaking (as native tongue) University students. They promote other tours that you may sign up for and pay for. For example, the St. Peters free tour is followed with a paid tour of the Vatican Musuem and the Sistine Chapel. Sorry...can't remember the name of the company.

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Zanardelli
HotelInfo.Address: via Giuseppe Zanardelli, 7, 00186 Rome, Italy
